xxl.core.collections.bags
Class DecoratorBag<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.bags.DecoratorBag<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the decorated bag's elements.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Bag<E>, Decorator<Bag<E>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
UnmodifiableBag
public abstract class DecoratorBag<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Bag<E>, Decorator<Bag<E>>

The class provides a decorator for a bag that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides). It provides a more flexible way to add functionality to a bag or one of its subclasses as by inheritance.

To provide this functionality the class contains a reference to the bag to be decorated. This reference is used to redirect method calls to the original bag. This class is an abstract class although it provides no abstract methods. That's so because it does not make any sense to instanciate this class which redirects every method call to the corresponding method of the decorated container without adding any functionality.

Usage example (1). 

     // create a new decorated bag that adds functionality to the insert method and leaves the
     // other methods untouched

     DecoratorBag bag = new DecoratorBag(new ListBag()) {
         public void insert (Object object) {

             // every desired functionality can be added to this method

             System.out.println("Before the insertion of the specified object!");
             super.insert(object);
             System.out.println("After the insertion of the specified object!");
         }
     }

See Also:
Cursor, Function, Iterator

Field Detail

bag

protected Bag<E> bag
A reference to the bag to be decorated. This reference is used to perform method calls on the original bag.

Constructor Detail

Constructs a new DecoratorBag that decorates the specified bag.

Parameters:
bag - the bag to be decorated.
Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Removes all elements from this bag. The bag will be empty after this call so that size() == 0.

Specified by:
clear in interface Bag<E>

close

public void close()
Closes this bag and releases any system resources associated with it. This operation is idempotent, i.e., multiple calls of this method take the same effect as a single call. When needed, a closed bag can be implicitly reopened by a consecutive call to one of its methods. Because of having an unspecified behavior when this bag is closed every cursor iterating over the elements of this bag must be closed.
Note: This method is very important for bags using external resources like files or JDBC resources.

Specified by:
close in interface Bag<E>

cursor

public Cursor<E> cursor()
Returns a cursor to iterate over the elements in this bag without any predefined sequence. The cursor is specifying a view on the elements of this bag so that closing the cursor takes no effect on the bag (e.g., not closing the bag). The behavior of the cursor is unspecified if this bag is modified while the cursor is in progress in any way other than by calling the methods of the cursor.

Specified by:
cursor in interface Bag<E>
Returns:
a cursor to iterate over the elements in this bag without any predefined sequence.

insert

public void insert(E object)
Adds the specified element to this bag. This method does not perform any kind of duplicate detection.

Specified by:
insert in interface Bag<E>
Parameters:
object - element to be added to this bag.

insertAll

public void insertAll(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> objects)
Adds all of the elements in the specified iterator to this bag. This method does not perform any kind of duplicate detection. The behavior of this operation is unspecified if the specified iterator is modified while the operation is in progress.

Specified by:
insertAll in interface Bag<E>
Parameters:
objects - iterator whose elements are to be added to this bag.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of elements in this bag (its cardinality). If this bag contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE elements, Integer.MAX_VALUE is returned.

Specified by:
size in interface Bag<E>
Returns:
the number of elements in this bag (its cardinality).

query

public Cursor<E> query(Predicate<? super E> predicate)
Returns a cursor to iterate over all elements in this bag for which the given predicate returns true. This method is very similar to the cursor method except that its result is determined by a predicate. Like the cursor returned by the cursor method, this cursor's behavior is unspecified if this bag is modified while the cursor is in progress in any way other than by calling the methods of the cursor.

Specified by:
query in interface Bag<E>
Parameters:
predicate - a predicate that determines whether an element of this bag should be returned or not.
Returns:
a cursor to iterate over all elements in this bag for which the given predicate returns true.
